title: Stocks to buy under ₹100: Experts recommend six shares to buy tomorrow j— 6 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Stocks to buy under ₹100: Experts recommend six shares to buy tomorrow

Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: LiveMint

Following weak global market cues, the Indian stock market experienced a downturn but shows signs of resilience. Experts have recommended six stocks under ₹100 for potential buyers.

Key Points:

  • The Nifty 50 index closed at 24,043, down 183 points.
  • The BSE Sensex dropped 773 points, closing at 79,170.
  • Key sectors showing gains included Media, Oil & Gas, and Consumer Durables.
  • Market experts recommend six stocks to buy: Yes Bank, Aartech Solonics, IDFC First Bank, Bank of Maharashtra, Manaksia Steels, and AMD Industries.

Notable Quotes:

“The near-term uptrend remains intact for Nifty.” - Nagaraj Shetti, HDFC Securities
“Ongoing consolidation will continue.” - Hrishikesh Yedve, Asit C Mehta

Recommended Stocks:

  • Yes Bank: Buy at ₹19.40-₹19.60, target ₹21.20
  • Aartech Solonics: Buy at ₹88.50, target ₹94
  • IDFC First Bank: Buy at ₹64-₹65.50, multiple targets
  • Bank of Maharashtra: Buy at ₹54-₹55, multiple targets
  • Manaksia Steels: Buy at ₹62.40, target ₹65
  • AMD Industries: Buy at ₹66.50, target ₹70.50

Disclaimer: Views expressed are those of individual analysts; investors are advised to seek certified expert opinions.
newTitle: Stocks to Buy Under ₹100: Expert Recommendations for January 6, 2025

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Here's what GMP signals ahead of listing | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO GMP and Subscription Update Ahead of Listing

Publication Date: January 5, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has shown overwhelming investor interest, being oversubscribed by 229.68 times overall. The listing is set for January 7, 2023, with a grey market premium indicating a potential listing price significantly higher than the IPO price.

Key Points:

  • IPO closed on January 2, 2023, with 1,94,53,89,519 shares bid for against 84,70,000 shares available.
  • Oversubscription rates: QIBs 242.40 times, NIIs 503.83 times, and retail investors 104.92 times.
  • Grey market price indicates a listing forecast at ₹311, a 44.65% rise from the IPO price of ₹215.
  • Fresh issue includes 86 lakh shares, with an OFS of 35 lakh shares.
  • Proceeds will be used for manufacturing capacity expansion, debt repayment, and investment in Barota Finance.
  • The IPO is valued at ₹260 crore, propelling market capitalization over ₹1,000 crore.
The grey market premium has seen a decrease from ₹99 on the allotment day to ₹96.

The strong demand for the Indo Farm Equipment IPO reflects robust investor confidence, with expectations of healthy performance upon its market debut.
newTitle: Indo Farm Equipment IPO GMP and Subscription Update Ahead of Listing

title: Pune-bound flyers spend over 7 hours in plane in Delhi - The Times of India
summary:
Pune-Bound Flyers Face 7-Hour Delay on Delhi Tarmac

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Passengers traveling from Delhi to Pune endured over seven hours on a grounded plane due to administrative and technical delays.

  • Flight operations were disrupted leading to significant frustration among travelers.
  • Many passengers reported health issues due to prolonged waiting and lack of communication.
  • The airline has promised a thorough investigation into the incident.
"This is unacceptable; we were left in the dark for too long." - Affected passenger

The airline's reputation is at stake as it faces increasing scrutiny from passengers and aviation authorities.

title: RBI Allows HDFC Bank To Acquire 9.5% Stake in AU Small Finance Bank; Details Here - News18
summary:
RBI Approves HDFC Bank's Acquisition of 9.5% Stake in AU Small Finance Bank

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: News18

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted HDFC Bank permission to acquire up to a 9.5% stake in AU Small Finance Bank. The approval is valid for a year from January 3, 2025.

  • HDFC Bank is allowed to hold up to 9.5% of AU SFB’s paid-up share capital or voting rights.
  • The approval extends to HDFC Bank's group companies as well.
  • This acquisition must be finalized before the approval lapses after one year.
  • HDFC Bank's shares saw a decline of 2.5% following the news.
“Aggregate holding includes shares owned by the bank, its subsidiaries, mutual funds, trustees, and promoter group entities.”

The acquisition reflects HDFC Bank's growth strategy and regulatory compliance amidst market volatility.
newTitle: RBI Approves HDFC Bank's Acquisition of 9.5% Stake in AU Small Finance Bank

title: Long-range cars spark up EV adoption drive - The Economic Times
summary:
Long-range cars spark up EV adoption drive

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Economic Times

India's electric car industry is on the verge of a transformation with a focus on long-range models, as consumers demand vehicles that can cover 300-680 km per charge. Declining battery costs and enhanced driving experiences, particularly in the SUV segment, are set to boost EV adoption beyond the current 2.5% market share.

  • 75% of electric vehicle buyers in 2024 preferred vehicles with a range of 300-500 km.
  • Top manufacturers plan to roll out at least 10 new EV models with ranges of 500-680 km by mid-2025.
  • The rising demand indicates that consumers see EVs as primary vehicles rather than just urban transportation.
  • Declining battery costs are enabling competitive pricing for higher-range vehicles.
  • Industry experts predict 2025 will be pivotal for EV adoption in India.
“Consumer interest, infrastructure development, and affordability are part of an interconnected ecosystem that's rapidly maturing.” - Ravi Bhatia, Jato Dynamics

The ongoing shift towards long-range electric vehicles marks a significant evolution in India's automotive landscape, hinting at broad future adoption and innovation in electric mobility.
newTitle: Long-range cars spark up EV adoption drive

title: Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A mixed trend for newly listed stocks, a look at top 5 performers - Upstox
summary:
Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A mixed trend for newly listed stocks, a look at top 5 performers

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Upstox

The last month of 2024 was a busy period for primary market investors with 30 mainboard and SME IPOs launched in December, raising nearly ₹1.9 crore. 15 mainboard IPOs were listed, with a positive trend as 13 stocks traded higher than their IPO prices.

  1. Mamata Machinery had a stellar debut, listing at ₹600 against an issue price of ₹243, currently trading at ₹545, up 133.41% from its IPO.
  2. One MobiKwik Systems debuted at ₹440, significantly rising above its issue price of ₹279, currently trading at ₹602.
  3. Unimech Aerospace listed at ₹1,460, down to ₹1,429.95, maintaining a gain of 85.62% from its issue price of ₹785.
  4. Transrail Lighting debuted at ₹590 and is currently trading at ₹626.55, reflecting a near 49% gain.
  5. Senores Pharmaceuticals is trading at ₹577.5, up 46.52% from its issue price of ₹391.

While Suraksha Diagnostic and Carraro India posted negative returns, the rest showed gains of over 40%.

"The stock positioning in the industry indicates potential further price appreciation for various companies."

Overall, December saw a trending positive for newly listed stocks, suggesting a robust appetite for IPOs despite some fluctuations.
newTitle: Mainboard IPOs in December 2024: A Mixed Trend for Newly Listed Stocks

title: Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained - The Hindu
summary:
Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained

Published: January 04, 2025, 11:05 pm IST

The article discusses the recent depreciation of the Indian rupee against the U.S. dollar, attributed mainly to foreign investor withdrawals and prevailing economic conditions.

  • The rupee breached the 85 mark against the U.S. dollar, reaching an all-time low of 85.81.
  • Factors affecting currency depreciation include monetary policy, foreign demand for goods, and inflation rates.
  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has intervened to support the rupee but foreign exchange reserves are at an eight-month low of $640 billion.
  • Long-term trends show the rupee's gradual depreciation is tied to high inflation rates compared to the U.S.
“Analysts believe the rupee’s depreciation would have been far worse if not for the RBI’s intervention to support the rupee against the dollar.”

In conclusion, the rupee's current depreciation reflects broader economic trends, investor behavior, and international monetary policy shifts, with implications for India's economic stability.
newTitle: Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained

title: Dividend, bonus, stock split: VTM to trade ex-dividend, Algoquant Fintech to trade ex-bonus next week; Check Full list | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Dividend, Bonus, Stock Split: Upcoming Trading Activities for VTM and Algoquant Fintech

Date: January 6, 2024 | Source: BSE Data

Introduction

VTM Limited is set to trade ex-dividend starting next week, while Algoquant Fintech Ltd and Padam Cotton Yarns Ltd will trade ex-bonus. Key corporate actions involving stock splits and bonus issues are highlighted.

Key Points

  • VTM Limited will trade ex-dividend on January 10, declaring an interim dividend of ₹0.25 per share.
  • Algoquant Fintech Ltd will trade ex-bonus on January 8, with a bonus issue ratio of 1:2.
  • Padam Cotton Yarns Ltd will also trade ex-bonus on January 8, offering a 1:1 bonus issue.
  • Multiple companies will undergo stock splits on January 8, including AA Plus Tradelink Ltd and Jagsonpal Pharmaceuticals Ltd.
  • Other corporate actions announced include ITC Ltd's shares spin-off and rights issues by Nibe Ordnance and Maritime Ltd.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

Bonus issues provide existing shareholders with additional shares instead of increasing dividend payouts.

Conclusion

These corporate actions reflect active management strategies by companies aiming to attract investors and enhance stock liquidity.
newTitle: Dividend, Bonus, Stock Split: Upcoming Trading Activities for VTM and Algoquant Fintech

title: HDFC Bank's Q3 CASA deposits decline, advances show modest growth - CNBCTV18
summary:
HDFC Bank's Q3 CASA deposits decline, advances show modest growth

Date: January 4, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

HDFC Bank announced its third-quarter update, revealing a slight decline in CASA deposits while reporting moderate growth in gross advances.

  • Gross advances reached ₹2,54,250 crore, up 0.9% QoQ and 3% YoY.
  • Total deposits increased by 2.5% QoQ and 15.8% YoY, totaling ₹2,56,350 crore.
  • CASA deposits fell by 1.2% QoQ and 4.4% YoY, standing at ₹87,250 crore.
  • Time deposits saw a 4.6% increase, reaching ₹1,69,100 crore, up 22.7% YoY.
  • Assets Under Management (AUM) grew by 2.5% QoQ and 7.6% YoY to ₹2,62,760 crore.
  • Credit-deposit ratio slightly decreased to 99.18% from 100.76% in Q2.
  • RBI allowed HDFC Bank to acquire a 9.5% stake in Kotak Mahindra Bank and others.

Gross Advances Up 0.9% QoQ & 3% YoY At ₹25,425 Bn
Deposits Up 2.5% QoQ & 15.8% YoY At ₹25,635 Bn
CASA Deposits Down 1.2% QoQ & 4.4% YoY At 8,725 Bn
Time Deposits Up 4.6% QoQ & 22.7% YoY At ₹16,910 Bn
AUM Up 2.5% QoQ & 7.6% YoY At ₹26,276

This financial performance indicates a mixed trend for HDFC Bank, with steady advances but challenges in the CASA segment, suggesting a careful approach needed for future growth.
newTitle: HDFC Bank Reports Decline in CASA Deposits with Modest Growth in Advances

Researchers Uncover Nuclei Vulnerability Enabling Signature Bypass and Code Execution - The Hacker News
summary:
Researchers Uncover Nuclei Vulnerability Enabling Signature Bypass and Code Execution

Publication Date: September 8, 2024 | Source: The Hacker News

A high-severity security flaw has been disclosed in ProjectDiscovery's Nuclei scanner, which could allow attackers to bypass signature checks and execute malicious code.

  • Vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-43405.
  • CVSS score of 7.4 out of 10, affecting all versions after 3.0.0.
  • The flaw is rooted in discrepancies in signature verification and YAML parser handling.
  • Successful exploitation allows attackers to inject malicious content while maintaining valid signatures.
  • Addressed by ProjectDiscovery in version 3.3.2 released on September 4, 2024.
“Attackers could craft malicious templates containing manipulated # digest lines to bypass Nuclei's signature verification,” said Wiz researcher Guy Goldenberg.

This vulnerability poses a significant risk for organizations using Nuclei, as misuse of untrusted templates could lead to severe security breaches.
newTitle: Researchers Discover High-Severity Vulnerability in Nuclei Scanner

title: Microsoft is spending $80 billion on data centers this year - Engadget
summary:
Microsoft's Major Investment: $80 Billion on Data Centers for AI

Published Date: 2025

Source: Engadget

Microsoft is set to invest $80 billion in AI-enabled data centers in 2025 as part of its strategy to enhance its artificial intelligence capabilities under the upcoming administration.

  • The budget will focus on building data centers, primarily in the United States, to train and deploy AI models.
  • Microsoft emphasizes the importance of governmental support for AI advancements.
  • The company acknowledges potential job displacement due to AI but believes new opportunities will ultimately outweigh these challenges.
  • Training of the workforce to leverage AI is deemed crucial.
  • Promotion of American AI exports is a major priority as competition with China intensifies.
“Without new partnerships founded on large-scale infrastructure investments, none of the progress on AI the industry has achieved thus far would be possible.” - Microsoft

In conclusion, Microsoft's bold investment signals its commitment to leading in AI technology while advocating for a supportive governmental framework to facilitate this vision.
newTitle: Microsoft's Major Investment: $80 Billion on Data Centers for AI

title: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know - News18
summary:
Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 19:32 IST

Quick commerce platform Zepto is gearing up to file its initial public offering (IPO) draft papers by March or April 2025, according to a report by The Economic Times. The company has permission to relocate its base from Singapore to India ahead of the public listing.

  • A critical board meeting on January 19 will finalise aspects of the IPO, including the appointment of bankers and determining the IPO size.
  • Data on the grey market premium will be available once the IPO process starts.
  • Zepto will become the first quick commerce startup to go public if successful.
  • Zepto is transitioning to a marketplace model, registered as Zepto Marketplace in October 2024.
  • Zepto raised USD 350 million in funding in November 2024 and plans to expand to over 50 cities.
“Zepto reported a 120 per cent increase in operating revenue to Rs 4,454 crore in FY24.”

The IPO process marks a significant step for Zepto as it seeks to expand and solidify its position in the quick commerce market.
newTitle: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

title: SBI Introduces New FD Schemes For Minors And Senior Citizens Aged 80+; Check Eligibility And New Rates - Zee News
summary:
SBI Introduces New FD Schemes For Minors And Senior Citizens Aged 80+

Date: Not specified, Source: Zee News

The State Bank of India (SBI) has announced two new deposit schemes, 'Har Ghar Lakhpati' for minors and 'SBI Patrons' for senior citizens aged 80 and above. The schemes aim to provide better financial options for these groups.

SBI ‘Har Ghar Lakhpati' Scheme

This is a pre-calculated recurring deposit scheme for deposits starting at Rs 1,00,000, allowing customers to plan for their financial goals, including those under 18.

Eligibility

  • All resident individuals can open an account.
  • Minors aged 10 years or older can open accounts independently or jointly with a parent or guardian.

'SBI Patrons' Scheme

This special term deposit option offers enhanced interest rates for senior citizens aged 80 and above, available for both new and existing customers.

Eligibility

  • Individuals aged 80 years or older can open accounts singly or jointly.
  • Joint accounts require the primary holder to be 80 or older.
  • Existing customers automatically receive additional interest when they reach 80.

SBI New FD Rates For Senior Citizens

Tenors Current FD Rates for Senior Citizens
7 days to 45 days 4.00%
46 days to 179 days 6.00%
180 days to 210 days 6.75%
211 days to less than 1 year 7.00%
1 year to less than 2 years 7.30%
2 years to less than 3 years 7.50%
3 years to less than 5 years 7.25%
5 years to less than 10 years 7.00%

Strategic Objectives

SBI's initiatives aim to enhance financial inclusion and strengthen its market leadership by offering tailored solutions for specific customer segments.
newTitle: SBI Introduces New FD Schemes For Minors And Senior Citizens Aged 80+; Check Eligibility And New Rates
